Has a §YLiege§!, §YVassal§!, or a §Yneighboring ruler§! who follows an §YEgyptian§! faith\n
In this new chapter of Kemetic faith we must remember that the Pharaohs have been a stabilising force for centuries and should remain so for centuries to come.
The Pharaoh of Aai-Kemet has certain territorial claims which they can press on lands once held by the ancient pharaohs.

The Egyptian religion is polytheistic, with a large selection of gods and cults. It originated in ancient Egypt and with the conquests of the Egyptian empire, it would go on to become the dominant religion in the middle east until the rise of the Roman empire. The faith has deteriorated in the centuries since it's downfall, it will take considerable effort to restore it's ancient institutions.
column3: La religion kémite est polythéiste, avec un grand nombre de dieux et de cultes. Elle est née dans l'Ancienne Egypte et s'étendit avec les conquestes de l'Empire Egyptien, au point de devenir la religion dominante au Moyen-Orient jusqu'à l'avènement de l'Empire Romain.

column2: The Kemetic religion is polytheistic, with a large selection of gods and cults. This modern, reformed version of the faith has re-incorporated and formalized many traditions from antiquity and formed new ones of it's own.
column3: La religion kémite est polythéiste, avec un grand nombre de dieux et de cultes. Elle est née dans l'Ancienne Egypte et s'étendit avec les conquestes de l'Empire Egyptien, au point de devenir la religion dominante au Moyen-Orient jusqu'à l'avènement de l'Empire Romain.

column2: The Atenic religion is a proto-monotheistic religion that split off from Kemetism. Originally founded by the pharaoh Akhenaten, this heresy usurped the position of supreme god, typically held by Amun, with Aten. In addition, this heresy completely disowns the other Kemetic gods in favour of Aten. The heresy died out shortly after Akhenaten's death.
column3: Le culte d'Aton est une religion proto-monothéiste qui dérive du Kémitisme. Fondée par le pharaon Akhénaton, cette hérésie plaça Aton en position de dieu supresme, au lieu de l'habituel Amon. De plus, cette hérésie balaie complètement les aultres dieux kémites en faveur d'Aton. L'hérésie disparut peu de temps après le trépas d'Akhénaton.

Palm trees were an important symbol of prosperity in Ancient Egyptian culture, in addition to the practical use of providing shade. The Master of Palms directs the small bureaucracy surrounding the proper planting and care of palm trees in the cities of their masters domain.

The Gods Wife was an important priestly title that was originally held by the sister or wife of the Pharoah. This title is now largely honorary and can be granted to any woman from the Pharoah's dynasty.

In ancient times this honor was given to a daughter of the pharoah, marking her as the heir to the current God's Wife of Amun. It was the second highest ranking title among priestesses. Much of it's importance has diminished in the intervening centuries, and it is now simply an honorary title granted to royal women.
Fan-bearer on the Right Hand of the King

One of the highest honors in a Kemetic kingdom, this title marks the bearer as one of the kings most trusted advisors. They stand at the king's side when they hold court, offering whatever opinions they have on the matter at hand. A large golden fan is their badge of office.
Literally meaning 'member of the elite', this title was originally used to designate the heir-apparent. It is now used to grant royal favor to members of the nobility.
In ancient times an extremely high ranking title, second only to the Iry-pat, it is now simply the burghers counterpart to the noble Iry-pat.
Meaning 'great royal sealer,' the Khetemty once was a bureaucratic office in charge of food distribution. It is now an honor bestowed on priests.
This character is a veteran of a Kemetic Great Holy War.
This character is a veteran of an Atenic Great Holy War.
This character is a master of desert terrain, lightning attacks leading troops in and out of combat quickly, and sieging enemy cities.
This character has been officially recognized as a demigod by the Kemetic Church.

Neo-Coptic represent a return to the ancient ways of the Egyptian people. The result of a revivalist movement in Egypt, elements of Ancient Egyptian language, customs, architecture, and art have all been adapted to serve the times.

A building dedicated to the study of war. Named after Anhur, the god of war, this temple is home to the elite Anhuri Warriors. Here these fighters hone their skills with the Khopesh and mounted archery.
A great monument to the glory of a past Pharoah. This pyramid serves as their tomb, preserving their body and worldly posessions for the afterlife.
